intro: Megaclinium inaequale, commonly known as the unequal clinium, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in shades of white or pale yellow. The plant has opposite, elliptic leaves with serrated edges, and it thrives in moist, shaded environments. It is native to parts of South America, particularly in regions with humid climates. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
